searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation:
Only satisfy the Search if the Beneficiary's last_updated Date falls within a specified DateRange. A DateRange can include both lo and hi date values, only a lo date value, or only a hi date value.

Examples:

  • &_lastUpdated=gt2023-01-02&_lastUpdated=lt2023-05-01
  • &_lastUpdated=gt2023-01-02
  • &_lastUpdated=lt2023-05-01

searchParam.name: excludeSAMHSA
searchParam.documentation:
The Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) is the agency within the U.S. Department of HHS that leads public health efforts to advance the behavioral health of the nation.

Setting this flag to true, modifies the request to filter out all SAMSHA-related claims from the response.ClaimResponse doesn't contain any SAMHSA potential data. Due to the 1:1 relationship between ClaimResponse and Claim, any ClaimResponse resource will be excluded when the associated Claim resource contains SAMHSA data.

Example:

  • &excludeSAMHSA=true

searchParam.name: isHashed
searchParam.documentation:
Setting this flag to true, indicates to the API that the mbi parameter in the same request is a hashed MBI rather than an unhashed MBI.

Example:

  • &isHashed=true

searchParam.name: mbi
searchParam.documentation:
Fetch Beneficiary data using a FHIR MBI identifier; an MBI represents the medicare benficiary ID, or as much of that defined by the FHIR specification as:

A combination of upper case ASCII letters ('A'..'Z except for S, L, O, I, B, and Z.', numerals ('0'..'9'), '-', with a length limit of 11 characters.The MBI ID has the following characters for each position:Position 1 - numeric values 1 thru 9Position 2 - alphabetic values A thru Z (minus S, L, O, I, B, Z)Position 3 - alpha-numeric values 0 thru 9 and A thru Z (minus S, L, O, I, B, Z)Position 4 - numeric values 0 thru 9Position 5 - alphabetic values A thru Z (minus S, L, O, I, B, Z)Position 6 - alpha-numeric values 0 thru 9 and A thru Z (minus S, L, O, I, B, Z)Position 7 - numeric values 0 thru 9Position 8 - alphabetic values A thru Z (minus S, L, O, I, B, Z)Position 9 - alphabetic values A thru Z (minus S, L, O, I, B, Z)Position 10 - numeric values 0 thru 9Position 11 - numeric values 0 thru 9

The following are all valid values for MBI, and all might represent the same resource:

  • 9AB2WW3GR44 (unhashed MBI)
  • 82273caf4d2c3b5a8340190ae3575950957ce469e593efd7736d60c3b39d253c (hashed)
  • 1S00E00HA26 (synthetic MBI)

searchParam.name: service-date
searchParam.documentation:
Only satisfy the Search request if a claim's Date falls within a specified DateRange. A DateRange can include both lo and hi date values, only a lo date value, or only a hi date value.

Examples:

  • &service-date=gt2023-01-02&service-date=lt2023-05-01
  • &service-date=gt2023-01-02
  • &_service-date=lt2023-05-01

searchParam.name: startIndex
searchParam.documentation:
When fetching a Bundle Response using pagination, this URL parameter represents an offset (starting point) into the list of elements for the Request.It is optional and defaults to 1 if not supplied.A value 0 is not allowed and negative indices are not currently supported.

Example:

  • startIndex=100

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation:
A list of one or more comma-separated claim types to be included in the request; within BFD, the claim types represent an OR inclusion logic meaning any claims matching one of the specified claim types will be checked.

Supported Claim Type values:

  • fiss
  • mcs

    • Examples:

    • type=fiss,mcs
    • type=fiss

searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation:
Only satisfy the Search if the Beneficiary's last_updated Date falls within a specified DateRange. A DateRange can include both lo and hi date values, only a lo date value, or only a hi date value.

Examples:

  • &_lastUpdated=gt2023-01-02&_lastUpdated=lt2023-05-01
  • &_lastUpdated=gt2023-01-02
  • &_lastUpdated=lt2023-05-01

Setting this flag to true, modifies the request to filter out all SAMSHA-related claims from the response.ClaimResponse doesn't contain any SAMHSA potential data. Due to the 1:1 relationship between ClaimResponse and Claim, any ClaimResponse resource will be excluded when the associated Claim resource contains SAMHSA data.

Example:

  • &excludeSAMHSA=true

searchParam.name: isHashed
searchParam.documentation:
Setting this flag to true, indicates to the API that the mbi parameter in the same request is a hashed MBI rather than an unhashed MBI.

Example:

  • &isHashed=true

searchParam.name: mbi
searchParam.documentation:
Fetch Beneficiary data using a FHIR MBI identifier; an MBI represents the medicare benficiary ID, or as much of that defined by the FHIR specification as:

A combination of upper case ASCII letters ('A'..'Z except for S, L, O, I, B, and Z.', numerals ('0'..'9'), '-', with a length limit of 11 characters.The MBI ID has the following characters for each position:Position 1 - numeric values 1 thru 9Position 2 - alphabetic values A thru Z (minus S, L, O, I, B, Z)Position 3 - alpha-numeric values 0 thru 9 and A thru Z (minus S, L, O, I, B, Z)Position 4 - numeric values 0 thru 9Position 5 - alphabetic values A thru Z (minus S, L, O, I, B, Z)Position 6 - alpha-numeric values 0 thru 9 and A thru Z (minus S, L, O, I, B, Z)Position 7 - numeric values 0 thru 9Position 8 - alphabetic values A thru Z (minus S, L, O, I, B, Z)Position 9 - alphabetic values A thru Z (minus S, L, O, I, B, Z)Position 10 - numeric values 0 thru 9Position 11 - numeric values 0 thru 9

The following are all valid values for MBI, and all might represent the same resource:

  • 9AB2WW3GR44 (unhashed MBI)
  • 82273caf4d2c3b5a8340190ae3575950957ce469e593efd7736d60c3b39d253c (hashed)
  • 1S00E00HA26 (synthetic MBI)

searchParam.documentation:
Only satisfy the Search request if a claim's Date falls within a specified DateRange. A DateRange can include both lo and hi date values, only a lo date value, or only a hi date value.

Examples:

  • &service-date=gt2023-01-02&service-date=lt2023-05-01
  • &service-date=gt2023-01-02
  • &_service-date=lt2023-05-01

searchParam.name: startIndex
searchParam.documentation:
When fetching a Bundle Response using pagination, this URL parameter represents an offset (starting point) into the list of elements for the Request.It is optional and defaults to 1 if not supplied.A value 0 is not allowed and negative indices are not currently supported.

Example:

  • startIndex=100

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation:
A list of one or more comma-separated claim types to be included in the request; within BFD, the claim types represent an OR inclusion logic meaning any claims matching one of the specified claim types will be checked.

Supported Claim Type values:

  • fiss
  • mcs

    • Examples:

    • type=fiss,mcs
    • type=fiss

searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation:
Only satisfy the Search if the Beneficiary's last_updated Date falls within a specified DateRange. A DateRange can include both lo and hi date values, only a lo date value, or only a hi date value.

Examples:

  • &_lastUpdated=gt2023-01-02&_lastUpdated=lt2023-05-01
  • &_lastUpdated=gt2023-01-02
  • &_lastUpdated=lt2023-05-01

searchParam.name: beneficiary
searchParam.documentation:
Fetch Beneficiary data using a FHIR IdType identifier; an IdType represents the logical identity for a resource, or as much of that identity that is known. In FHIR, every resource must have a logical ID which is defined by the FHIR specification as:

Any combination of upper or lower case ASCII letters ('A'..'Z', and 'a'..'z', numerals ('0'..'9'), '-' and '.', with a length limit of 64 characters. (This might be an integer, an un-prefixed OID, UUID or any other identifier pattern that meets these constraints.)

This class contains that logical ID, and can optionally also contain a relative or absolute URL representing the resource identity; the following are all valid values for IdType, and all might represent the same resource:

  • 123 (just a resource's ID)
  • beneficiary/123 (a relative identity)
  • http://example.com/beneficiary/123 (an absolute identity)

searchParam.name: startIndex
searchParam.documentation:
When fetching a Bundle Response using pagination, this URL parameter represents an offset (starting point) into the list of elements for the Request.It is optional and defaults to 1 if not supplied.A value 0 is not allowed and negative indices are not currently supported.

Example:

  • startIndex=100

searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation:
Only satisfy the Search if the Beneficiary's last_updated Date falls within a specified DateRange. A DateRange can include both lo and hi date values, only a lo date value, or only a hi date value.

Examples:

  • &_lastUpdated=gt2023-01-02&_lastUpdated=lt2023-05-01
  • &_lastUpdated=gt2023-01-02
  • &_lastUpdated=lt2023-05-01

searchParam.documentation:
The Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) is the agency within the U.S. Department of HHS that leads public health efforts to advance the behavioral health of the nation.

Setting this flag to true, modifies the request to filter out all SAMSHA-related claims from the response.

Example:

  • &excludeSAMHSA=true

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation:
Fetch Patient data using a FHIR IdType identifier; an IdType represents the logical identity for a resource, or as much of that identity that is known. In FHIR, every resource must have a logical ID which is defined by the FHIR specification as:

Any combination of upper or lower case ASCII letters ('A'..'Z', and 'a'..'z', numerals ('0'..'9'), '-' and '.', with a length limit of 64 characters. (This might be an integer, an un-prefixed OID, UUID or any other identifier pattern that meets these constraints.)

This class contains that logical ID, and can optionally also contain a relative or absolute URL representing the resource identity; the following are all valid values for IdType, and all might represent the same resource:

  • 123 (just a resource's ID)
  • Patient/123 (a relative identity)
  • http://example.com/Patient/123 (an absolute identity)

searchParam.name: service-date
searchParam.documentation:
Only satisfy the Search request if a claim's thru Date falls within a specified DateRange. A DateRange can include both lo and hi date values, only a lo date value, or only a hi date value.

Examples:

  • &service-date=gt2023-01-02&service-date=lt2023-05-01
  • &service-date=gt2023-01-02
  • &_service-date=lt2023-05-01

searchParam.name: startIndex
searchParam.documentation:
When fetching a Bundle Response using pagination, this URL parameter represents an offset (starting point) into the list of elements for the Request.It is optional and defaults to 1 if not supplied.A value 0 is not allowed and negative indices are not currently supported.

Example:

  • startIndex=100

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation:
A list of claim types that filters the response to contain only EoBs which have any of the specified claim types. This is optional and defaults to * (all types);

Supported Claim Type values:

  • carrier
  • inpatient
  • outpatient
  • hha
  • hospice
  • snf
  • dme
  • partd

Examples:

  • type=carrier,inpatient,snf,dme
  • type=outpatient
  • type=*

searchParam.name: _has:Coverage.extension
searchParam.documentation:
When searching for a Patient's Part D events information, this resource identifies the Part D contract value that will be used when determining eligibility.

Example:

  • _has:Coverage.extension=ABCD

searchParam.name: _has:Coverage.rfrncyr
searchParam.documentation:
When searching for a Patient's Part D events information, this resource identifies the reference year that will be applied when determining applicable Part D events.

Example:

  • _has:Coverage.rfrncyr=2023

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation:
Fetch Patient data using a FHIR IdType identifier; an IdType represents the logical identity for a resource, or as much of that identity that is known. In FHIR, every resource must have a logical ID which is defined by the FHIR specification as:

Any combination of upper or lower case ASCII letters ('A'..'Z', and 'a'..'z', numerals ('0'..'9'), '-' and '.', with a length limit of 64 characters. (This might be an integer, an un-prefixed OID, UUID or any other identifier pattern that meets these constraints.)

This class contains that logical ID, and can optionally also contain a relative or absolute URL representing the resource identity; the following are all valid values for IdType, and all might represent the same resource:

  • 123 (just a resource's ID)
  • Patient/123 (a relative identity)
  • http://example.com/Patient/123 (an absolute identity)

searchParam.name: _lastUpdated
searchParam.documentation:
Only satisfy the Search if the Beneficiary's last_updated Date falls within a specified DateRange. A DateRange can include both lo and hi date values, only a lo date value, or only a hi date value.

Examples:

  • &_lastUpdated=gt2023-01-02&_lastUpdated=lt2023-05-01
  • &_lastUpdated=gt2023-01-02
  • &_lastUpdated=lt2023-05-01

searchParam.name: cursor
searchParam.documentation:
Provide a pagination cursor for processing Patient's Part D events information; this resource identifies a numeric offset into a result set.

Example:

  • cursor=200

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: The patient identifier to search for

searchParam.name: startIndex
searchParam.documentation:
When fetching a Bundle Response using pagination, this URL parameter represents an offset (starting point) into the list of elements for the Request.It is optional and defaults to 1 if not supplied.A value 0 is not allowed and negative indices are not currently supported.
